intro: Uncaria firma, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. However, it is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid growth and ecological impact.
